page.title: 05Terry's Chocolate Factory
page.content: Terry's came to Hemsworth as a packing station in 1964,and was extended in 1968. The chocolates are sent from York to be packed in Hemsworth. There are one hundred and seventy-eight full time jobs but extra personel are employed seasonally. The factory buillding was formerly used as a roller rink and a dance hall. In one year, 5,000 tonnes of chocolate bars and about 3,000 tonnes of chocolate are packed in Hemsworth. The Council were very pleased that Terry's chose to come here as unemployment is very high in this area.
